FELL SHORT OF.Definition: did not reach (a goal or hope)

DISCLAIMER.Definition: a warning that says something may be unsettling or not  safe

UNSETTLING.Definition: making someone feel worried or upset

BANNERS.Definition: long signs with words or pictures on them

SUBHEADER.Definition: a small title under the big one

POSTER.Definition: a big paper with pictures or words put on a wall

MIND YOU.Definition: used to add something important or different

COUP.Definition: a sudden, violent, and unlawful taking of power

EXTORTED.Definition: forced to give money by threats or force

RADICALS.Definition: people with strong and extreme ideas

DITCH.Definition: a small hole or channel in the ground

WAIST.Definition: the middle part of the body, above the hips

CONVINCING.Definition: making you believe they were true

AUTOPSY.Definition: the check on the dead body to find out how he had died

TYRE.Definition: the rubber part around a car wheel

FLOATED.Definition: circulated or passed from person to person

STACK UP.Definition: add up or seem quite right

TORTURED.Definition: hurt badly to get answers or punish him

INTERROGATED.Definition: asked many questions, often in a hard way

RALLYING CRY.Definition: a saying or idea that brought people together

UNRAVEL.Definition: slowly make it known or solved

GRABBING.Definition: taking or catching suddenly or roughly

BETRAYED.Definition: tricked or deceived (by someone he trusted)

EXTRADITE.Definition: send them to another country for trial

PROOF.Definition: something that showed it was true

STAND TRIAL.Definition: go to court to be judged

UNTRACEABLE.Definition: unable to be found, discovered, or traced

IRONY.Definition: when the opposite of what you expect happens
